publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3699 Mr Andrew Arbuckle: Scotch Beef—That the Parliament congratulates the Minister for Environment and Rural Development in getting beef produce back into European markets by holding a successful banquet of Scottish produce in Brussels last week; notes that, prior to the beef ban being implemented, beef exports provided a multi-million pound input into the Scottish economy; agrees that an increase in beef exports will give a much-needed boost to the Scottish farming industry; further welcomes increasing confidence in Scotch beef, and agrees that the development of a reinvigorated market in beef will be good for Scotland. Supported by: Mr Jim Wallace*, Mike Pringle*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Margaret Smith*, Iain Smith*
S2M-3699 Scotch Beef (lodged on 7 December 2005) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Euan Robson*

S2M-3699 Mr Andrew Arbuckle: Scotch Beef—That the Parliament congratulates the Minister for Environment and Rural Development in getting beef produce back into European markets by holding a successful banquet of Scottish produce in Brussels last week; notes that, prior to the beef ban being implemented, beef exports provided a multi-million pound input into the Scottish economy; agrees that an increase in beef exports will give a much-needed boost to the Scottish farming industry; further welcomes increasing confidence in Scotch beef, and agrees that the development of a reinvigorated market in beef will be good for Scotland. Supported by: Mr Jim Wallace, Mike Pringle, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Margaret Smith, Iain Smith, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Euan Robson, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-3699 Scotch Beef (lodged on 7 December 2005) Christine Grahame*
S2M-3699 Scotch Beef (lodged on 7 December 2005) Elaine Smith*
